Question: How does a YES vote help you meet the district's needs? How will you address the district‚Äôs needs with a ZERO TAX RATE CHANGE?

Answer: Basically, the bond (or mortgage) we took out to build Lotus will be paid off. This means that--if we do nothing, or if the referendum fails--the tax rate drops 59 cents per $100 of home value for all taxpayers. It's kind of like a bank account when the mortgage is paid...you get that money back. In this case, it would be the taxpayers who get the money back.

By asking our taxpayers to keep the rate EXACTLY WHERE IT IS, the District keeps that 59 cents per $100 of home value for each home. We can repurpose the money since we no longer have to pay the bond on Lotus. In doing so, we free up the funds to pay for much needed building improvements at both sites, pay our teachers so they are no longer the lowest compensated in Lake County, and purchase current instructional materials to make sure our students have an equitable and current learning experience. The bottom line is that a "YES" referendum gives us funds each year to meet our needs.
